page.title: 06FOLKLORE * TRADITIONS
page.content: Firle Place is the centre of the estate owned by Lord Gage that covers the area around Firle. Various customs are based around the house. Every other year a country fair is held in the Park.This includes greyhound racing, horse jumping and stalls. Firle village also celebrates bonfire night with a large bonfire, many fireworks and a procession involving bonfire societies from all over Sussex. Ascention Day is marked in the village by the school. The school goes for a walk on the Downs.They are joined by villagers and church people. Morris dancing and May Dancing are both part of village life.
